dt: {bc}subjective evidence of disease or physical disturbance
{bc}something that indicates the presence of bodily disorder
{bc}an evident reaction by a plant to a pathogen
{bc}something that indicates the existence of something else

pt: {sc}sign{/sc} {sc}mark{/sc} {sc}token{/sc} {sc}note{/sc} {sc}symptom{/sc} mean a discernible indication of what is not itself directly perceptible. {sc}sign{/sc} applies to any indication to be perceived by the senses or the reason.
{sc}mark{/sc} suggests something impressed on or inherently characteristic of a thing often in contrast to general outward appearance.
{sc}token{/sc} applies to something that serves as a proof of something intangible.

pt.t: this gift is a {it}token{/it} of our esteem

pt: {sc}note{/sc} suggests a distinguishing mark or characteristic.

pt.t: a {it}note{/it} of irony in her writing

pt: {sc}symptom{/sc} suggests an outward indication of an internal change or condition.

pt.t: rampant crime is a {it}symptom{/it} of that city's decay

et: Late Latin {it}symptomat-, symptoma{/it}, from Greek {it}symptōmat-, symptōma{/it} happening, attribute, symptom, from {it}sympiptein{/it} to happen, from {it}syn-{/it} + {it}piptein{/it} to fall {ma}{mat|feather|}{/ma}
shortdef: subjective evidence of disease or physical disturbance; broadly : something that indicates the presence of bodily disorder
an evident reaction by a plant to a pathogen
something that indicates the existence of something else

dt: {bc}a group of symptoms (such as facial flushing, palpitations, headache, sweating, and numbness or burning in or around the mouth) held to affect susceptible persons eating food heavily seasoned with monosodium glutamate
While there are numerous anecdotal reports of MSG symptom complex, research has failed to establish a clear, definitive link between the consumption of MSG and adverse reactions.

dt.t: … this flavor enhancer is not without its critics. Reports have cited the possibility of {ldquo}{wi}MSG symptom complex{/wi},{rdquo} which is characterized by burning sensations, numbness, and tingling in parts of the body.

In consideration of the three well-designed studies described above, MSG could not be demonstrated as the causal agent of the {wi}MSG symptom complex{/wi}. When ingested with meals, MSG did not elicit the adverse reactions initially reported in 1968.

shortdef: a group of symptoms (such as facial flushing, palpitations, headache, sweating, and numbness or burning in or around the mouth) held to affect susceptible persons eating food heavily seasoned with monosodium glutamate

dt: {bc}a disorder characterized by a heightened awareness of various physical bodily sensations or symptoms accompanied by the tendency to interpret these sensations and symptoms as indicative of medical illness

{bc}the manifestation of one or more physical bodily sensations, symptoms, or complaints (such as pain, fatigue, or shortness of breath) that cannot be fully explained by a medical condition and that causes excessive concern, distress, anxiety, preoccupation, and impairment

dt.t: The major criteria for {wi}somatic symptom disorder{/wi} are persistent (lasting 6 months or more), significant somatic symptoms that are associated with disproportionate thoughts, feelings, and behaviors, such as extreme levels of anxiety.

shortdef: a disorder characterized by a heightened awareness of various physical bodily sensations or symptoms accompanied by the tendency to interpret these sensations and symptoms as indicative of medical illness; specifically : the manifestation of one or more physical bodily sensations, symptoms, or complaints (such as pain, fatigue, or shortness of breath) that cannot be fully explained by a medical condition and that causes excessive concern, distress, anxiety, preoccupation, and impairment
